Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the cost of Obamacare by stating that it will cost $50,000 per enrollee over the next 10 years.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide enough evidence or support to back up the statement that Obamacare will cost $50,000 per enrollee.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that dividing the total cost of $1.35 trillion by the number of newly insured people accurately represents the per enrollee cost, which is disputed by experts.
Exist alternative explanation: Experts argue that dividing a 10-year spending number by the average number of newly insured people is not an accurate way to calculate the cost per enrollee.
